## Functions

### alignToARMConstant() {#a0bf132fca1d70790323a51a61f306321}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static uint32&#95;t alignToARMConstant (uint32&#95;t Value)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Get the minimum constant for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a> that is greater than or equal to the argument.

In <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a>, constants can have any value that can be produced by rotating an 8-bit value to the right by an even number of bits within a 32-bit word.

Definition at line <a href="#l03102">3102</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["static"]}>
Emit an instruction sequence that will align the address in register Reg by zero-ing out the lower bits.

For versions of the architecture that support Neon, this must be done in a single instruction, since skipAlignedDPRCS2Spills assumes it is done in a single instruction. That function only gets called when optimizing spilling of D registers on a core with the Neon instruction set present.

### getMaxFPOffset() {#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static int getMaxFPOffset (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget">ARMSubtarget</a> &amp; STI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo">ARMFunctionInfo</a> &amp; AFI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
We need the offset of the frame pointer relative to other <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo">MachineFrameInfo</a> offsets which are encoded relative to SP at function begin.

See also emitPrologue() for how the FP is set up. Unfortunately we cannot determine this value in determineCalleeSaves() yet as <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/prologepiloginserter-cpp/#abde55543f0bbb31306a6cd2af297fe9f">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> hasn&#39;t run at this point. Instead we use this to produce a conservative estimate that we check in an <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert()</a> later.

<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The stack grows downward.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All of the individual frame areas on the frame below are optional, i.e. it&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// possible to create a function so that the particular area isn&#39;t present</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the frame.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// At function entry, the &quot;frame&quot; looks as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   | Higher address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | arguments passed on the stack     |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- sp</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   | Lower address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// After the prologue has run, the frame has the following general structure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Technically the last frame area (VLAs) doesn&#39;t get created until in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// main function body, after the prologue is run. However, it&#39;s depicted here</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for completeness.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   | Higher address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | arguments passed on the stack     |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- (sp at function entry)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | varargs from registers            |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | prev&#95;lr                           |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | prev&#95;fp                           |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | (a.k.a. &quot;frame record&quot;)           |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -| &lt;- fp (r7 or r11)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | callee-saved gpr registers        |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | callee-saved fp/simd regs         |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |.empty.space.to.make.part.below....|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |.aligned.in.case.it.needs.more.than| (size of this area is unknown at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |.the.standard.8-byte.alignment.....|  compile time; if present)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------|</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | local variables of fixed size     |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// | including spill slots             |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- base pointer (not defined by ABI,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |.variable-sized.local.variables....|       LLVM chooses r6)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |.(VLAs)............................| (size of this area is unknown at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |...................................|  compile time)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |-----------------------------------| &lt;- sp</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// |                                   | Lower address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To access the data in a frame, at-compile time, a constant offset must be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// computable from one of the pointers (fp, bp, sp) to access it. The size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the areas with a dotted background cannot be computed at compile-time</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if they are present, making it required to have all three of fp, bp and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sp to be set up to be able to access all contents in the frame areas,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assuming all of the frame areas are non-empty.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For most functions, some of the frame areas are empty. For those functions,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it may not be necessary to set up fp or bp:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; A base pointer is definitely needed when there are both VLAs and local</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   variables with more-than-default alignment requirements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; A frame pointer is definitely needed when there are local variables with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   more-than-default alignment requirements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In some cases when a base pointer is not strictly needed, it is generated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// anyway when offsets from the frame pointer to access local variables become</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// so large that the offset can&#39;t be encoded in the immediate fields of loads</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or stores.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The frame pointer might be chosen to be r7 or r11, depending on the target</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// architecture and operating system. See ARMSubtarget::getFramePointerReg for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// details.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Outgoing function arguments must be at the bottom of the stack frame when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// calling another function. If we do not have variable-sized stack objects, we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can allocate a &quot;reserved call frame&quot; area at the bottom of the local</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// variable area, large enough for all outgoing calls. If we do have VLAs, then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the stack pointer must be decremented and incremented around each call to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// make space for the arguments below the VLAs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As two SEH instructions are appended here, they won&#39;t get interleaved</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// between the two final movw/movt instructions, but it doesn&#39;t make any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// practical difference.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Emit an instruction sequence that will align the address in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// register Reg by zero-ing out the lower bits.  For versions of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// architecture that support Neon, this must be done in a single</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instruction, since skipAlignedDPRCS2Spills assumes it is done in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// single instruction. That function only gets called when optimizing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// spilling of D registers on a core with the Neon instruction set</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We need the offset of the frame pointer relative to other MachineFrameInfo</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// offsets which are encoded relative to SP at function begin.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// See also emitPrologue() for how the FP is set up.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Unfortunately we cannot determine this value in determineCalleeSaves() yet</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// as assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots() hasn&#39;t run at this point. Instead we use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this to produce a conservative estimate that we check in an assert() later.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865" lineLink="#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92">getMaxFPOffset</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget">ARMSubtarget</a> &amp;STI, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo">ARMFunctionInfo</a> &amp;AFI,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp;MF) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4b">ARMSubtarget::PushPopSplitVariation</a> PushPopSplit =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><span class="doxyHighlight">      STI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#aada6bb4af36a2736480f0c51fced2d58">getPushPopSplitVariation</a>(MF);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For Thumb1, push.w isn&#39;t available, so the first push will always push</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// r7 and lr onto the stack first.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (AFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> -AFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#aac9af25844daf41c00656fdfc6770f72">getArgRegsSaveSize</a>() - (2 &#42; 4);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is a conservative estimation: Assume the frame pointer being r7 and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pc(&quot;r15&quot;) up to r8 getting spilled before (= 8 registers).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxRegBytes = 8 &#42; 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (PushPopSplit == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba79139b30a7b6a6caf15fe7c26898cb1c">ARMSubtarget::SplitR11AAPCSSignRA</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Here, r11 can be stored below all of r4-r15.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><span class="doxyHighlight">    MaxRegBytes = 11 &#42; 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (PushPopSplit == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba2fba6120097ea9615c4a13a82fe8042d">ARMSubtarget::SplitR11WindowsSEH</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Here, r11 can be stored below all of r4-r15 plus d8-d15.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><span class="doxyHighlight">    MaxRegBytes = 11 &#42; 4 + 8 &#42; 8;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="882"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FPCXTSaveSize =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><span class="doxyHighlight">      (STI.hasV8&#95;1MMainlineOps() &amp;&amp; AFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a8f1878c79642d2dcaa3e790cff3ed926">isCmseNSEntryFunction</a>()) ? 4 : 0;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (HasFP &amp;&amp; isARM)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Restore from fp only in ARM mode: e.g. sub sp, r7, #24</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note it&#39;s not safe to do this in Thumb2 mode because it would have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// taken two instructions:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov sp, r7</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sub sp, #24</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If an interrupt is taken between the two instructions, then sp is in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// an inconsistent state (pointing to the middle of callee-saved area).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The interrupt handler can end up clobbering the registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><span class="doxyHighlight">      AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#aeebbc8bb36d06a4c62b09481cd3d94cb">setShouldRestoreSPFromFP</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Set FP to point to the stack slot that contains the previous FP.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For iOS, FP is R7, which has now been stored in spill area 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, if this is not iOS, all the callee-saved registers go</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into spill area 1, including the FP in R11.  In either case, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is in area one and the adjustment needs to take place just after</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that push.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> AfterPush;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (HasFP) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Offset from SP immediately after the push which saved the FP to the FP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// save slot.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><span class="doxyHighlight">    int64&#95;t FPOffsetAfterPush;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (FramePtrSpillArea) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#ae692133c8b7797ea452164db2ee27247ab4cac6a2af8e38b52df0dce99c1c3c22">SpillArea::GPRCS1</a>:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1580"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1581"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FrameReg = ARM::SP;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1582"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> += SPAdj;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1583"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1584"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SP can move around if there are allocas.  We may also lose track of SP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1585"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when emergency spilling inside a non-reserved call frame setup.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1586"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> hasMovingSP = !<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armframelowering/#a7d1c91b20625d31982210d6fc381104d">hasReservedCallFrame</a>(MF);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1587"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1588"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When dynamically realigning the stack, use the frame pointer for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1589"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// parameters, and the stack/base pointer for locals.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1590"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;hasStackRealignment(MF)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1591"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetframelowering/#a0c361440fb8d1e36932e65c8cc8497e7">hasFP</a>(MF) &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;dynamic stack realignment without a FP!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1592"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isFixed) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1594"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> = FPOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1595"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (hasMovingSP) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><span class="doxyHighlight">      FrameReg = <a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;getBaseRegister();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If there is a frame pointer, use it when we can.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetframelowering/#a0c361440fb8d1e36932e65c8cc8497e7">hasFP</a>(MF) &amp;&amp; AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a08384b77b981503bea5f54694d29aef4">hasStackFrame</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isFixed || (hasMovingSP &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;hasBasePointer(MF))) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (hasMovingSP) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Try to use the frame pointer if we can, else use the base pointer</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1617"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (FPOffset &gt;= -255 &amp;&amp; FPOffset &lt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1619"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FPOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1620"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1621"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1622"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a6c02973966a15241aedb2a1016de4ff3">isThumbFunction</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1623"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Prefer SP to base pointer, if the offset is suitably aligned and in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1624"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// range as the effective range of the immediate offset is bigger when</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1626"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Use  add &lt;rd&gt;, sp, #&lt;imm8&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1627"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      ldr &lt;rd&gt;, &#91;sp, #&lt;imm8&gt;&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1628"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> &amp; 3) == 0 &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> &lt;= 1020)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1630"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In Thumb2 mode, the negative offset is very limited. Try to avoid</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1633"><span class="doxyHighlight">        FrameReg = <a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;getFrameRegister(MF);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1635"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1636"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> &gt; (FPOffset &lt; 0 ? -FPOffset : FPOffset)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1637"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, use SP or FP, whichever is closer to the stack slot.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1639"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FPOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1640"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1641"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1642"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Use the base pointer if we have one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1643"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Maybe prefer sp on Thumb1 if it&#39;s legal and the offset is cheaper?</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1645"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;hasBasePointer(MF)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1851"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1852"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Mark the D-register spill slots as properly aligned.  Since MFI computes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1853"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stack slot layout backwards, this can actually mean that the d-reg stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1854"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// slot offsets can be wrong. The offset for d8 will always be correct.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1855"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> : CSI) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1857"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DNum &gt; NumAlignedDPRCS2Regs - 1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1858"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1859"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FI = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>.getFrameIdx();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1860"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The even-numbered registers will be 16-byte aligned, the odd-numbered</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1861"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// registers will be 8-byte aligned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1862"><span class="doxyHighlight">    MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#af4c34648ca4596767ff0c3409fc3f2d9">setObjectAlignment</a>(FI, DNum % 2 ? <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(8) : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(16));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1863"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1864"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The stack slot for D8 needs to be maximally aligned because this is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1865"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// actually the point where we align the stack pointer.  MachineFrameInfo</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1866"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// computes all offsets relative to the incoming stack pointer which is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1867"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bit weird when realigning the stack.  Any extra padding for this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1868"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// over-alignment is not realized because the code inserted below adjusts</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1869"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the stack pointer by numregs &#42; 8 before aligning the stack pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1870"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DNum == 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1871"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#af4c34648ca4596767ff0c3409fc3f2d9">setObjectAlignment</a>(FI, MFI.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineframeinfo/#a3836203fac855ac3c5718b701bd13ffd">getMaxAlign</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1872"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1873"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1874"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Move the stack pointer to the d8 spill slot, and align it at the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1875"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// time. Leave the stack slot address in the scratch register r4.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1876"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1877"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   sub r4, sp, #numregs &#42; 8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1878"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   bic r4, r4, #align - 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1879"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   mov sp, r4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1880"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1900"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a0bd30ba570d7cadf1358f8054ffe4af3">emitAligningInstructions</a>(MF, AFI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, ARM::R4, MaxAlign, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1901"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1902"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// mov sp, r4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1903"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The stack pointer must be adjusted before spilling anything, otherwise</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1904"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the stack slots could be clobbered by an interrupt handler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1905"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Leave r4 live, it is used below.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1981"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Skip past the code inserted by emitAlignedDPRCS2Spills, and return an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1982"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// iterator to the following instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1983"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1984" lineLink="#a0409e368b6e75e93e77f9c29a03edbe9"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="#a0409e368b6e75e93e77f9c29a03edbe9">skipAlignedDPRCS2Spills</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1985"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumAlignedDPRCS2Regs) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1986"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   sub r4, sp, #numregs &#42; 8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1987"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   bic r4, r4, #align - 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1988"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   mov sp, r4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1989"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1991"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2333"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We are planning to use NEON instructions vst1 / vld1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2334"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a3825368aca2bc1550d173660df4da6a6">getSubtarget</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget">ARMSubtarget</a>&gt;().hasNEON())</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Don&#39;t bother if the default stack alignment is sufficiently high.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2346"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We always spill contiguous d-registers starting from d8. Count how many</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2347"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// needs spilling.  The register allocator will almost always use the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2348"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// callee-saved registers in order, but it can happen that there are holes in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2349"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the range.  Registers above the hole will be spilled to the standard DPRCS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2350"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// area.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2351"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumSpills = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2352"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (; NumSpills &lt; 8; ++NumSpills)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2353"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!SavedRegs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector/#a15d63c566878e964c19139b2c76c0dab">test</a>(ARM::D8 + NumSpills))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2354"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2356"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Don&#39;t do this for just one d-register. It&#39;s not worth it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2357"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NumSpills &lt; 2)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2358"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2359"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2539"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2540"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2541"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2542"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (PushPopSplit != <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armsubtarget/#ab3f7c70dd539567001e35caea74ade4ba5ba862e3a9b6eca2a66b539bd990761c">ARMSubtarget::SplitR7</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2543"><span class="doxyHighlight">        UnspilledCS1GPRs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(Reg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2544"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2545"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2546"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2547"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Reg) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2548"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R0: </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2549"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R2: </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2550"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R4: </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R5:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2551"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R6: </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::R7:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2552"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ARM::LR:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2553"><span class="doxyHighlight">        UnspilledCS1GPRs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(Reg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2554"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2555"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2556"><span class="doxyHighlight">        UnspilledCS2GPRs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(Reg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2557"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2558"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2559"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2560"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2561"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2562"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ForceLRSpill = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2563"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!LRSpilled &amp;&amp; AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2564"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FnSize = <a href="#a558790807cf5c060c4c82f09decb89d5">EstimateFunctionSizeInBytes</a>(MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2565"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Force LR to be spilled if the Thumb function size is &gt; 2048 This enables</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2566"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// use of BL to implement far jump.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2567"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (FnSize &gt;= (1 &lt;&lt; 11)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2568"><span class="doxyHighlight">      CanEliminateFrame = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2569"><span class="doxyHighlight">      ForceLRSpill = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2570"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2571"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2572"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2573"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If any of the stack slot references may be out of range of an immediate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2574"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// offset, make sure a register (or a spill slot) is available for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2575"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register scavenger. Note that if we&#39;re indexing off the frame pointer, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2576"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// effective stack size is 4 bytes larger since the FP points to the stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2577"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// slot of the previous FP. Also, if we have variable sized objects in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2578"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function, stack slot references will often be negative, and some of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2579"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// our instructions are positive-offset only, so conservatively consider</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2580"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that case to want a spill slot (or register) as well. Similarly, if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2581"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the function adjusts the stack pointer during execution and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2582"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// adjustments aren&#39;t already part of our stack size estimate, our offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2583"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// calculations may be off, so be conservative.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2584"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: We could add logic to be more precise about negative offsets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2585"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        and which instructions will need a scratch register for them. Is it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2586"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        worth the effort and added fragility?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2587"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EstimatedStackSize =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2588"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MFI.estimateStackSize(MF) + 4 &#42; (NumGPRSpills + NumFPRSpills);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2589"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2590"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Determine biggest (positive) SP offset in MachineFrameInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2591"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxFixedOffset = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2592"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = MFI.getObjectIndexBegin(); <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> &lt; 0; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2593"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxObjectOffset = MFI.getObjectOffset(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) + MFI.getObjectSize(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2594"><span class="doxyHighlight">    MaxFixedOffset = std::max(MaxFixedOffset, MaxObjectOffset);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2595"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2596"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2597"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasFP = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetframelowering/#a0c361440fb8d1e36932e65c8cc8497e7">hasFP</a>(MF);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2598"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (HasFP) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2599"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a08384b77b981503bea5f54694d29aef4">hasStackFrame</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2600"><span class="doxyHighlight">      EstimatedStackSize += 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2601"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2602"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If FP is not used, SP will be used to access arguments, so count the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2603"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// size of arguments into the estimation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2604"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EstimatedStackSize += MaxFixedOffset;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2605"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2606"><span class="doxyHighlight">  EstimatedStackSize += 16; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For possible paddings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2607"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2608"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit, EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2609"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasNonSPFrameIndex = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2610"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (AFI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armfunctioninfo/#a5638ad10fa6d78adda170a382dc7f75a">isThumb1OnlyFunction</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2611"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For Thumb1, don&#39;t bother to iterate over the function. The only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2612"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction that requires an emergency spill slot is a store to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2613"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// frame index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2614"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2615"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// tSTRspi, which is used for sp-relative accesses, has an 8-bit unsigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2616"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// immediate. tSTRi, which is used for bp- and fp-relative accesses, has</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2617"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a 5-bit unsigned immediate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2618"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2619"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We could try to check if the function actually contains a tSTRspi</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2620"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that might need the spill slot, but it&#39;s not really important.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2621"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Functions with VLAs or extremely large call frames are rare, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2622"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if a function is allocating more than 1KB of stack, an extra 4-byte</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2623"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// slot probably isn&#39;t relevant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2624"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2625"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A special case is the scenario where r11 is used as FP, where accesses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2626"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to a frame index will require its value to be moved into a low reg.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2627"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is handled later on, once we are able to determine if we have any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2628"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// fp-relative accesses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2629"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;hasBasePointer(MF))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2630"><span class="doxyHighlight">      EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit = (1U &lt;&lt; 5) &#42; 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2631"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2632"><span class="doxyHighlight">      EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit = (1U &lt;&lt; 8) &#42; 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2633"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit = (1U &lt;&lt; 5) &#42; 4;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2634"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2635"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2636"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64framelowering-cpp/#ac3ad986bc12b8c9ef4ebf86b4ed7b3c3">estimateRSStackSizeLimit</a>(MF, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, HasNonSPFrameIndex);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2637"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit = EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2638"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2639"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Final estimate of whether sp or bp-relative accesses might require</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2640"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// scavenging.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2641"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasLargeStack = EstimatedStackSize &gt; EstimatedRSStackSizeLimit;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2642"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2643"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the stack pointer moves and we don&#39;t have a base pointer, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2644"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// estimate logic doesn&#39;t work. The actual offsets might be larger when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2645"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we&#39;re constructing a call frame, or we might need to use negative</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2646"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// offsets from fp.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2647"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasMovingSP = MFI.hasVarSizedObjects() ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2648"><span class="doxyHighlight">    (MFI.adjustsStack() &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armframelowering/#a5a1aad4b6babbb473d1b342d32125d14">canSimplifyCallFramePseudos</a>(MF));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2649"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasBPOrFixedSP = <a href="/docs/api/structs/reginfo">RegInfo</a>-&gt;hasBasePointer(MF) || !HasMovingSP;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2650"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2651"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have a frame pointer, we assume arguments will be accessed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2652"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// relative to the frame pointer. Check whether fp-relative accesses to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2653"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// arguments require scavenging.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2654"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2655"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We could do slightly better on Thumb1; in some cases, an sp-relative</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2656"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// offset would be legal even though an fp-relative offset is not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2657"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxFPOffset = <a href="#a91f8cc6b8028d57ce1153c7d36c5cc92">getMaxFPOffset</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/armframelowering/#adc26971dee5e964321b8ea6daa72639d">STI</a>, &#42;AFI, MF);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2658"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasLargeArgumentList =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2659"><span class="doxyHighlight">      HasFP &amp;&amp; (MaxFixedOffset - MaxFPOffset) &gt; (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight">)EstimatedRSFixedSizeLimit;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2660"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2661"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BigFrameOffsets = HasLargeStack || !HasBPOrFixedSP ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2662"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         HasLargeArgumentList || HasNonSPFrameIndex;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2693"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the number of extra spills inserted for callee-save GPRs which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2694"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// would not otherwise be used by the function. When greater than zero it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2695"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// guaranteees that it is possible to scavenge a register to hold the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2697"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to tSTRi, i.e. r4-r7. For other subtargets, this is any GPR, i.e. r4-r11</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2698"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or lr.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2700"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we don&#39;t insert a spill, we instead allocate an emergency spill</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2701"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// slot, which can be used by scavenging to spill an arbitrary register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2702"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2703"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We currently don&#39;t try to figure out whether any specific instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2704"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// requires scavening an additional register.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2709"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// restore the high registers (which aren&#39;t allocatable, but could be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2710"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// used by inline assembly) because the push/pop instructions can not</span></CodeLine>
